framework
Class FrameworkImpl

java.lang.Object
  framework.FrameworkImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Framework
public class FrameworkImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Framework

The class implements the methods contained in the Framework Interface. the class specifies how the grid for the game should be initialised, what rules should be used to determine the next state, how the GUI should interact with the framework to display the game and provides some User features that enhance user experience.

Author:
Gautham Nagaraju, Akash Kulkarni, Prakhar Dubey, Victor Dong

init

public void init()
Description copied from interface: Framework
The default initialisation of the game. By default the game is initialised to Convay's Game of Life.

Specified by:
init in interface Framework

init

public void init(Rule r,
                 Grid g,
                 javax.swing.Icon[] imageMap,
                 java.awt.Color[] colorMap)
The method initialises the default grid, if the client doesn't provide a grid to initialise.

Specified by:
init in interface Framework
Parameters:
Void -

init

public void init(Grid g)
The method initialises the grid using the grid supplied by the client and the default set of rules for the cellular automata. Rules refers to the characteristics of a particular automata. By default the rules will refer to Convay's Game of Life.

Specified by:
init in interface Framework
Parameters:
g - the grid to initialise.

setRule

public void setRule(Rule r)
The method sets the rules for determining what the next state for each cell will be.

Specified by:
setRule in interface Framework
Parameters:
r - the rules to use for determining the next state.

nextGrid

public void nextGrid()
The method generates the grid after one unit of time, thereby, updating all the cells to the next state.

Specified by:
nextGrid in interface Framework
Parameters:
Void -

display

public void display()
The method generates the GUI for displaying the grid as the grid updates itself. It also provides the user a bunch of options in the GUI that enhance user interaction.

Specified by:
display in interface Framework
Parameters:
Void -

advance

public void advance(int num)
The method simulates the evolution of the automata through the given number of steps.

Specified by:
advance in interface Framework
Parameters:
num - the number of steps to simulate the automata.

step

public void step(int num)
The method generates the grid after num number of time steps.

step in interface Framework

num - The number of time steps after which to generate the grid.

setGrid

public void setGrid(Grid g)
Description copied from interface: Framework
This method sets the grid to be considered in the current game. It should ideally be set in the beginning of the game.

Specified by:
setGrid in interface Framework
Parameters:
g - the grid for the game to be set to.
